TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TreeViewCancelEventArgs extends System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs

Docs.summary: Provides data for the , , , and events of a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md).
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to change the collapse state of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeView> so that all the checked nodes are visible. First, all the nodes are collapsed, and a handler is added to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeView.BeforeExpand?displayProperty=nameWithType> event. Next, all the nodes are expanded. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeView.BeforeExpand?displayProperty=nameWithType> event handler determines whether a given node has child nodes that are checked. If a node does not have checked children, the expansion is canceled for that node. In order to allow normal node expansion when the plus sign next to a node is clicked, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeView.BeforeExpand?displayProperty=nameWithType> event handler is then removed.
This behavior can also be implemented by handling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeView.BeforeCollapse?displayProperty=nameWithType> event, as illustrated in the example for that topic.
For the complete example, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeView.CheckBoxes%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> reference topic.
[!code-cpp[TreeViewShowCheckedNodes1#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/TreeViewShowCheckedNodes1/CPP/treeviewshowcheckednodes1.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[TreeViewShowCheckedNodes1#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/TreeViewShowCheckedNodes1/CS/treeviewshowcheckednodes1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[TreeViewShowCheckedNodes1#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/TreeViewShowCheckedNodes1/VB/treeviewshowcheckednodes1.vb#2)]

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this member. In the example, an event handler reports on the occurrence of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeView.BeforeCheck?displayProperty=nameWithType> event. This report helps you to learn when the event occurs and can assist you in debugging. To report on multiple events or on events that occur frequently, consider replacing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MessageBox.Show%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> with <xref:System.Console.WriteLine%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> or appending the message to a multiline <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox>.
To run the example code, paste it into a project that contains an instance of type <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeView> named `TreeView1`. Then ensure that the event handler is associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeView.BeforeCheck?displayProperty=nameWithType> event.
[!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#626](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples/CS/EventExamples.cs#626)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#626](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples/VB/EventExamples.vb#626)]

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to change the collapse state of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeView> so that all the checked nodes are visible. First, all the nodes are collapsed, and a handler is added to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeView.BeforeExpand?displayProperty=nameWithType> event. Next, all the nodes are expanded. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeView.BeforeExpand?displayProperty=nameWithType> event handler determines whether a given node has child nodes that are checked. If a node does not have checked children, the expansion is canceled for that node. In order to allow normal node expansion when the plus sign next to a node is clicked, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeView.BeforeExpand?displayProperty=nameWithType> event handler is then removed.
This behavior can also be implemented by handling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeView.BeforeCollapse?displayProperty=nameWithType> event, as illustrated in the example for that topic.
For the complete example, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TreeView.CheckBoxes%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> reference topic.
